tree.title: MacroHard
tree.description: One-person billion-dollar company. AI-native. One human, infinite leverage.

children.title: Infrastructure
children.description: Permanent org unit. Tooling, systems, memory, dev infrastructure. Always in progress — never "done".

children.title: Telos
children.description: Work management system. Hierarchical goals + ROI prioritization + D3 viz. Single source of truth.

children.title: Core build (DB + CLI + viz)
children.description: SQLite schema, CLI, prioritization engine, D3 browser visualization.

children.title: Establish as single source of truth
children.description: Loaded real backlog, restructured tree (Infrastructure org unit, Business Development, ownership rules), briefed Forge and Conductor, updated all agent MEMORY.md files, created and deployed telos-workflow skill to all 4 agents.

children.title: Telos: Add Idea Backlog Feature
children.description: Add idea backlog to Telos UI and CLI. Track business ideas with status (active/parked/rejected), rationale, key decisions. Currently in MACROHARD_IDEAS.md (Atlas workspace) — Telos needs native support. CLI: telos idea add/list/update. UI: dedicated Ideas tab.

children.title: Bug: Dashboard shows stale data — no live DB connection
children.description:
Dashboard reads static telos-data.json (generated by 'viz' export) instead of querying the DB live. Result: any add/update/complete operation is invisible in the UI until viz is manually re-run.

Two acceptable fixes:
1. Auto-run viz export after every write operation (add/update/complete/block/refuse) — low effort, keeps current architecture
2. Replace static JSON with a live SQLite query in the dashboard server — cleaner, eliminates the export step entirely

Prefer option 2 if feasible without major refactor. Option 1 is acceptable as a quick fix.

Workaround until fixed: run 'node src/cli.js viz --output web/telos-data.json' manually after data changes.

children.title: Bug: No cache-control headers — browser caches stale JSON
children.description: Python http.server doesn't set Cache-Control headers. Browser caches telos-data.json indefinitely. Hard refresh (Ctrl+Shift+R) required to see updates. Fix: replace http.server with a minimal server that sets 'Cache-Control: no-store' on JSON responses, or switch to live DB queries (see node 16).

children.title: Dashboard: live DB connection (replace static JSON export)
children.description: Dashboard currently reads from a static telos-data.json file that must be manually re-exported after every change. Replace with a live connection to the SQLite DB — either a lightweight local API server (e.g. express endpoint at /api/tree) that the frontend polls, or a WebSocket for push updates. Goal: refresh in the browser reflects reality without any manual viz step.

children.title: Add start_date + end_date fields to nodes
children.description: Add start_date and end_date fields to the nodes schema (INTEGER timestamps, nullable). start_date = planned start, end_date = planned completion (deadline). Update CLI: add --start-date and --end-date flags to 'add' and 'update' commands. Update ROI/next query to weight tasks with approaching end_date higher (cost of delay). Show dates in 'show' output and dashboard tooltips.

children.title: Telos: task progress tracking (%, steps, sub-agent status)
children.description: Currently Telos only has open/in_progress/blocked/done. No way to see how far along a task is mid-execution, or track sub-agent work. Add: progress field (0-100%), optional step log (append-only notes on what's been done so far), and a way for sub-agents to post updates back to their Telos node while running. Dashboard should show progress bars on in_progress nodes.

notes.text: Dashboard progress bars + API endpoint done

children.title: Telos: Mobile-friendly web UI (PWA-ready)
children.description: Redesign the Telos dashboard as a mobile-first responsive web app. Requirements: (1) Works well on phone screen — tree collapses/expands by tap, cards stack vertically, readable without zoom. (2) PWA-ready: manifest.json + service worker so it can be 'Add to Home Screen' on iOS/Android. (3) Keep desktop layout working. (4) No framework required — vanilla JS/CSS is fine. Mobile-first CSS, hamburger or bottom nav if needed. Goal: usable from phone while on the go. Can be wrapped in Capacitor/React Native later.

children.title: Telos: Expandable description field in UI
children.description: Add expandable description to each node in the dashboard. Default: collapsed (shows first line or truncated). Click/tap to expand full description. Should work on both desktop and mobile. Nice to have: inline edit of description from the UI.

children.title: Telos: Filter done tasks older than N days (default 1d)
children.description: Add a filter to the dashboard UI: hide tasks with status=done that were completed more than N days ago. Default N=1. Configurable via a UI control (e.g. dropdown or input: 'Hide done tasks older than: [1] day'). Setting should persist in localStorage. Filter should be ON by default. Keeps the tree clean without deleting history.

children.title: Telos: Add shelved, rejected, in_question statuses
children.description: Add three new node statuses to the CLI and DB schema: (1) shelved — deprioritised, not deleted, not active. Will revisit. (2) rejected — decided against, kept for history. (3) in_question — needs clarification before work can proceed. UI: distinct colours for each (e.g. shelved=grey, rejected=dark red/strikethrough, in_question=amber/yellow). CLI: node src/cli.js shelve <id>, node src/cli.js reject <id>, node src/cli.js question <id> --reason '...' . These statuses should be excluded from the 'next' command output by default.

children.title: Deploy Telos web app publicly (internet-accessible)
children.description: Make the Telos dashboard reachable from the internet so Andreas can access it from his phone anywhere. Options to evaluate: (1) Nginx reverse proxy on the host machine with a subdomain (e.g. telos.pyfio.de or telos.macrohard.ai) + Let's Encrypt SSL. (2) Expose via existing tunneling setup if available. (3) Static export deployed to Vercel/Netlify (simpler, no server needed — but loses live DB connection). Recommended: nginx reverse proxy on the machine with SSL. The Telos HTTP server is already persistent (task #12 done). Just needs to be proxied and secured. Must be password-protected or IP-restricted — this has internal business data.

children.title: Auto-commit cron: re-enable or kill
children.description: Cron job to auto-commit OpenClaw workspace is currently DISABLED. Needs a decision.

children.title: Memory upgrade: evaluate QMD + ClawVault
children.description: Evaluate QMD (local hybrid BM25+vector memory backend) and ClawVault (structured memory layer). Full eval report: /home/jared/.openclaw/agents/conductor/memory/qmd-clawvault-eval.md (completed 2026-02-24 by Gemini Flash subagent). Security assessed by Conductor 2026-02-24. Verdict: QMD safe (Tobi Lutke / Shopify, featured in OC official release). ClawVault OK pending code review of openclaw hooks. Recommendation: install both, QMD first.

children.title: Telos: persistent HTTP server (survives reboots)
children.description: Dashboard at localhost:8088 currently dies when shell closes. Make it a proper service.

children.title: Create telos-workflow skill for all agents
children.description: Skill teaching all agents how to structurally do work via Telos. Covers the core loop (find→start→work→close→viz), node creation rules, sub-node discipline, blocker handling, definition of done, ownership map, and full CLI reference. Artifacts: /home/jared/.openclaw/agents/{atlas,forge,conductor,main}/skills/telos-workflow/. Added to main+conductor agent configs, gateway restarted.

children.title: Create management skill (living doc, daily review)
children.description: Management operating system skill for all agents. Covers WIP limits, daily cadence, prioritization, task discipline, definition of done, and daily refuse review. Daily cron at 09:00 CET reviews Telos state and updates the skill based on what worked/didn't. Artifacts: /home/jared/.openclaw/agents/*/skills/management/

children.title: Configure Google AI Pro (Antigravity) provider
children.description: SHELVED: Andreas got banned from Google AI Pro for using the OAuth token with OpenClaw — violates Google ToS. Do not attempt to re-enable. google-antigravity-auth plugin has been disabled. Remove from active queue.

children.title: WA typing indicator patch — post-update checklist
children.description: The WA typing indicator patch (disables sendPresenceUpdate composing calls) must be re-applied after every npm update openclaw. File: grep -rl 'sendPresenceUpdate.*composing' ~/.npm-global/lib/node_modules/openclaw/dist/ — comment out both calls. Last applied: 2026.2.22-2 on channel-web-pz2P6JD5.js lines 616+788. Should become a post-update script or be tracked per version.

children.title: Improve cost estimation accuracy
children.description: Built ~/.openclaw/scripts/cost-report.py — accurate JSONL cost scanner with: per-agent + per-model breakdown, cache efficiency %, runaway session detection (>), CSV daily log (cost-log.csv) for Anthropic cross-validation, alert thresholds (5/5). Updated HEARTBEAT.md to use new script. First run revealed 5.49 in 24h (urgent): Forge + Atlas ran on Sonnet 4.6 instead of their primaries across 3-day sessions. Surfaced to Andreas.

children.title: Install ClawVault (structured memory layer)
children.description: QMD is live. Next: install ClawVault. Steps: (1) npm install -g clawvault (2) Read hook source code at ~/.npm-global/lib/node_modules/clawvault/hooks/ — security review before enabling (3) openclaw hooks install clawvault (4) openclaw hooks enable clawvault only if code review passes (5) openclaw hooks init clawvault to create vault (6) Test that task/decision primitives work. Eval report: /home/jared/.openclaw/agents/conductor/memory/qmd-clawvault-eval.md

children.title: Set up Claude Code for Forge agent
children.description: Claude Code is likely installed but not properly configured for Forge. Conductor to: (1) Check if claude-code / coding-agent skill is installed (check ~/.npm-global/lib/node_modules/openclaw/skills/coding-agent/SKILL.md). (2) Vet the skill per security protocol — read all scripts, check for unexpected network calls, review dependencies. (3) Set up Claude Code in Forge's workspace: correct API key, model config, working directory defaults. (4) Test it works — run a trivial task via Claude Code from Forge's context. (5) Document setup in Forge's TOOLS.md. (6) If the coding-agent skill needs updating or additional config, handle it. This unlocks Forge to delegate complex coding tasks to Claude Code subagents instead of grinding through them in-session.

children.title: Monitor Claude Code usage by Forge
children.description: Track how Forge uses Claude Code in practice: (1) Which tasks delegated to Claude Code vs done in-session? (2) Cost per task — is Claude Code cost-effective vs Forge doing it directly? (3) Optimization opportunities: caching, model selection (Haiku vs Sonnet for simple tasks), prompt efficiency. (4) Build a lightweight usage log or parse JSONL + claude-sessions to get per-task cost breakdown. Report findings to Andreas monthly.

children.title: Set up Google Drive access for agents
children.description: gog CLI is installed + authenticated (zweice@gmail.com) but missing Drive scopes (403 insufficientPermissions). Steps: (1) Re-auth gog with Drive scope: 'gog auth login --scopes drive' or equivalent (2) Test: 'gog drive ls' returns files (3) Read gog Drive skill docs to understand upload/share/folder ops (4) Create a MacroHard shared folder in Drive for document exchange (5) Document in TOOLS.md how to upload/share files via gog. Goal: agents can push documents (PDFs, CSVs, reports) to a shared Drive folder Andreas can access.

children.title: Propagate Drive-as-artifacts rule to all agents
children.description: Andreas has mandated: Google Drive is the single source of truth for all artifacts (except code). Add this rule to AGENTS.md and/or MEMORY.md for Forge, Conductor, and Jared. Rule: any file produced as a deliverable (docs, CSVs, reports, templates, guides) must be uploaded to the appropriate MacroHard Drive folder on task completion. Folder structure: Leads/ (lead lists, outreach), Deliverables/ (parser output, exports), Shared/ (client-facing), Internal/ (research, agent outputs), Finance/ (invoices, costs). Access via gog CLI. Atlas already does this — other agents must adopt the same practice.

children.title: Autonomous Operations
children.description: Telephony (Vapi), financial automation, tunneling, proactive agent ops.

children.title: Vapi telephony integration
children.description: Voice agent via Vapi — inbound/outbound call handling.

children.title: Secure tunneling setup
children.description: Cloudflare Tunnel infrastructure deployed. (1) Patched Telos server.js + api-server.js to bind 127.0.0.1 via HOST env var. (2) Fixed telos-dashboard.service to use linuxbrew node (v25), created telos-api.service. (3) Created ~/.cloudflared/config.yml with ingress rules template. (4) Created ~/.config/systemd/user/cloudflared.service. (5) Scripts: quick-tunnel.sh (immediate, no account) + setup-named-tunnel.sh (one-time interactive setup for named tunnel). Quick tunnel tested — connects via QUIC to ham01. Named tunnel requires: run ~/.openclaw/scripts/setup-named-tunnel.sh (needs CF account + domain). Artifacts: memory/tunnel-setup.md.

children.title: Financial automation (invoice parsing)
children.description: Auto-parse incoming invoices, categorize expenses.

children.title: Business Development
children.description: Unstructured data middleware for logistics. Vision LLMs parse chaotic freight PDFs (commercial invoices, packing lists, BOLs) into clean CSV/Excel for mid-sized freight forwarders (Speditionen) in Hamburg-Bremen-Hannover. No ERP integration in v1 — pure file delivery. Target: 15 clients × €350/month = €5k/month profit. GTM: Shadow Pilot (50 PDFs free, no commitment). See MACROHARD_IDEAS.md.

children.title: Freight Document Parser — MVP
children.description: Parser MVP: code complete. Test samples available at /home/jared/.openclaw/agents/forge/freight-parser/test_samples/ — 3 valid PDFs: freight-forwarding-sample.pdf (Livingston freight invoice), commercial-invoice-columbia.pdf, sample_bol.pdf. Run test_parser.py against these. Report accuracy + cost-per-doc.

children.title: Lead List: Hamburg-Bremen-Hannover Freight Forwarders
children.description: 56 freight forwarders across Hamburg (23), Bremen (16), Hannover (14), multi-city (3). CSV at /home/jared/.openclaw/agents/atlas/leads/freight-forwarders-de.csv. 8 verified decision makers with titles/LinkedIn. README with breakdown and outreach angles at /home/jared/.openclaw/agents/atlas/leads/README.md.

children.title: Shadow Pilot Outreach Sequence
children.description: 3-touch email sequence + 60-sec phone script, DE and EN. Fax variant included. Tone: peer-to-peer, operational. Artifacts: /home/jared/.openclaw/agents/atlas/outreach/shadow-pilot-sequence.md. Personalization vars: [Firma/Name/Dokumenttyp]. Ready to send — needs Andreas approval before any outreach.

children.title: Shadow Pilot Execution
children.description:
Run 3-5 shadow pilots for interested prospects. Each pilot: receive their 50 worst freight PDFs, run through the document parser, QA output, return clean Excel within 48h. Track: accuracy rate, processing time, cost per document, any edge cases or failures. This is both a sales activity and a product validation step.

DEPENDENCY: Blocked on ID 15 (Freight Document Parser MVP) complete and validated. Also blocked on Anthropic API key being provisioned.

Coordinate with Andreas for client communication and file transfer.

notes.text: Unblocked — API key confirmed, #15 complete. Awaiting client PDFs for pilot runs.

Accuracy test suite rebuilt and committed (830cbd2 → github.com/zweice/freight-parser). 88.9% accuracy on 16/18 fields — core fields (shipper, consignee, invoice no., date, total, currency, incoterms, country of origin) all 100%. Port of loading/discharge not extracted by commercial invoice schema — known gap. Still awaiting client PDFs to run pilot.

children.title: Convert Shadow Pilot to Paid
children.description:
Follow-up sequence after shadow pilot delivery to convert to a paying customer. Pricing options to present: (1) Per-document: €3-8/doc, no commitment — low friction entry point. (2) Flat monthly: €350/month for up to 500 docs/month — target for recurring revenue. Present ROI calculation based on their actual pilot results (hours saved × hourly rate). Goal: first signed paying customer. Template: short follow-up email with concrete ROI numbers from their pilot + simple pricing sheet. No sales calls required — async email.

DEPENDENCY: Blocked on ID 20 (Shadow Pilot Execution) complete. ID 20 in turn blocked on ID 15 (Freight Document Parser MVP). Do not start until at least one shadow pilot has been delivered and client feedback received.

notes.text: Templates complete: outreach/conversion-templates.md — DE+EN conversion emails, ROI calculator (auto-computes hours saved + monthly value from pilot data), 2 pricing tiers (pay-per-doc €3-8 + flat €350/500docs), follow-up Day 5+10 sequence, send checklist. Awaiting shadow pilot delivery (task #20) before deployment. Andreas approval required to send.

children.title: Scale: Reach 15 Paying Clients (€5k/month)
children.description: Reach 15 paying clients at ~€350/month average = €5,250 MRR. This is the profitability milestone. Requires: automated delivery pipeline (no manual QA per client), repeatable outreach process, stable pricing model. At this stage: evaluate whether to hire or continue fully automated.

children.title: Outreach Wave 1: Send faxes to 8 HOT leads
children.description: Execute first outreach wave: personalize 8 fax covers from fax-covers-hot-wave1.md, send via fax service, log in lead tracker. Blocked on Andreas approval (#47).

children.title: Track + follow up Wave 1 responses
children.description: Monitor Wave 1 responses: call-backs, emails, interest signals. Route interested leads to shadow pilot sequence. Blocked on Wave 1 being sent.

children.title: Outreach Wave 2: 20 warm leads (no active trigger)
children.description: Second wave: 20 companies from lead list without active hiring trigger. Fax + 5-day follow-up email. Blocked on Wave 1 results + Andreas approval.

children.title: Targeting Pipeline
children.description: Lightweight B2B targeting pipeline for freight forwarder outreach. Turns the raw lead list into scored, personalised, channel-appropriate outreach ready for Andreas approval.

children.title: Lead scoring: rank top 30 from 202
children.description: Scored all 202 leads on size fit, specialization complexity, named contact, and notes signals. Top 30 ranked. Artifacts: /home/jared/.openclaw/agents/atlas/leads/top30-scored.csv. Max score 8 (Rhenus Freight Logistics Bremen), average 4.3/9.

children.title: Trigger monitoring: job postings + LinkedIn activity
children.description: For top 30 leads: check for recent job postings (Sachbearbeiter, Speditionskaufmann = manual scaling signal), recent LinkedIn/Xing posts. Flag anyone posting about pain or hiring admin roles in last 30 days — these are highest-priority contacts.

children.title: Channel decision per lead (email/phone/fax/LinkedIn)
children.description: Channel assigned per lead based on: named contact → Phone primary; tech signal → Email primary; Mittelstand/no contact → Fax primary. Mix: Fax 22, Phone 5, Email 3. DSGVO note: fax/post cleaner than cold email. Artifact: leads/crm.csv (channel_primary + channel_fallback columns).

children.title: Personalisation brief per lead (top 30)
children.description: 30 personalisation briefs written, one per lead. Each covers: (1) situation/context, (2) specific pain point, (3) value angle for outreach. Feeds directly into copy personalisation. Artifact: outreach/personalisation-briefs.md

children.title: Outreach copy: email + fax templates (DE + EN)
children.description: Templates complete: 3-touch email (DE+EN), fax variant (DE), phone script (DE+EN), LinkedIn/Xing DM (DE+EN). CTA: shadow pilot offer. Artifact: outreach/shadow-pilot-sequence.md. Needs Andreas review before any send.

children.title: CRM-light: response tracking spreadsheet
children.description: CRM CSV with all 30 leads loaded. Columns: rank, score, company, city, employees, contact, contact_title, website, channel_primary, channel_fallback, status, date_contacted, date_replied, touch, notes. Status values: not_contacted|contacted|opened|replied|interested|shadow_pilot|converted. Artifact: leads/crm.csv

children.title: BD Pipeline Launch Brief for Andreas
children.description: Compile clear one-page briefing for Andreas showing: BD pipeline is complete, 6 HOT leads identified, 8 first-wave targets ranked, exact actions needed from Andreas (1: approve outreach send, 2: Anthropic API key for shadow pilot). Pipeline has been sitting built for 24h+ waiting on Andreas green light. Deliverable: outreach/bd-launch-brief.md

children.title: Provision Anthropic API key for shadow pilot
children.description: Key found in /home/jared/.openclaw/.env — ANTHROPIC_API_KEY already set.

children.title: Andreas: approve outreach launch (first wave 8 companies)
children.description: The entire BD outreach pipeline is built and ready. First wave: 8 companies with HOT triggers (actively hiring admin staff). Review bd-launch-brief.md in outreach/ folder. Decision needed: (1) Say 'send it' to approve, OR specify changes. Fax copy templates ready, phone scripts ready. All templates in outreach/shadow-pilot-sequence.md. Without this approval, the pipeline sits idle and HOT leads cool down.

children.title: Set up fax sending service for outreach
children.description: 4 of 6 HOT leads + 18 of 30 total leads have Fax as primary channel. Without a fax service, 73% of outreach pipeline is blocked. RECOMMENDATION: simple-fax.de — no monthly fee, pay-per-fax, German service, no commitment. Ideal for cold outreach trial (30 faxes ~€15-30 total). Alternatives: fax.de (German, established), eFax (€16/month). Steps: (1) Register at simple-fax.de, (2) top up credits, (3) test with 1 internal fax, (4) send production faxes. A4 cover page templates already drafted in outreach/shadow-pilot-sequence.md. DSGVO: fax is lower risk than cold email for B2B Kaltakquise in DE.

children.title: Build test corpus: 90 freight docs (30 clean + 30 bad + 30 worst quality)
children.description: Current test suite has only 4-6 PDFs — not enough to validate the parser properly. Build a 90-file corpus: (1) Source 30 real freight documents (commercial invoices, BOLs, packing lists) from open sources online — look for sample PDFs on logistics company sites, government customs portals, trade finance templates. Mix of layouts, languages (DE/EN/CN), document types. (2) Write a degradation script that takes a clean PDF and produces two degraded versions: BAD (simulate a single fax/scan pass — reduce DPI to ~150, add slight noise/blur), WORST (simulate scan of a scan — 72 DPI, heavy noise, slight rotation, low contrast). Use ImageMagick or Pillow. (3) Output: 30 originals + 30 bad + 30 worst = 90 files total in test_samples/. (4) Re-run test_parser.py against all 90. Report accuracy by quality tier. Success bar: >80% on originals, >60% on bad, report worst as-is.

children.title: Set up payment + invoicing
children.description: When a prospect says yes to €350/month, we need to collect payment. Recommendation: start simple — manual SEPA invoice via email. Zero cost, fully compliant B2B. Deliverables: (1) German invoice template PDF (Rechnung) with Andreas' company details, IBAN, BIC, tax ID or Kleinunternehmerregelung note, payment terms 14 days; (2) Brief on legal entity — does MacroHard need Gewerbeschein/UG before invoicing?; (3) When volume hits 3+ clients: evaluate Stripe or Lexoffice for recurring automation. CRITICAL: invoice must be sendable within 1h of prospect saying yes — do NOT let payment logistics delay first sale.

notes.text: Invoicing setup written: outreach/invoicing-setup.md — German invoice template (§14 UStG compliant), Kleinunternehmer variant (§19 UStG, no VAT), invoice numbering system, per-doc + flat billing variants, legal entity checklist for Andreas, Phase 2 tool comparison. Action items for Andreas: confirm Gewerbeanmeldung status, provide name/address/Steuernummer/IBAN. First invoice can go out in <5 min once details provided.

children.title: Customer onboarding: PDF handoff + delivery process
children.description: After a customer signs, how do they send PDFs and receive results? This must be documented before first paid customer. Options: (1) Email — client emails PDFs, we reply with Excel. Simple, zero setup. Limit: Gmail 25MB attachment cap, no audit trail. (2) Shared folder — Nextcloud, Google Drive, or Dropbox shared folder per client. Client drops PDFs, we deliver Excel to same folder. Clean audit trail. Recommended. (3) SFTP — for enterprise clients later. Action: set up shared folder template in cloud storage. Write 1-page onboarding doc (DE+EN) explaining: where to drop files, format requirements, turnaround SLA, what the Excel output looks like. This doc gets attached to the first invoice.

notes.text: Onboarding guide written: outreach/customer-onboarding.md — DE+EN, covers: folder setup (inbox/delivered/archive per client), supported doc types, DPI requirements, delivery SLAs (24/48/72h by batch size), Excel output structure per doc type, exception flagging, pricing table, support contact. Ready to attach to first invoice.

children.title: Sammelaufstellung: digitize + searchable archive (idea)
children.description: IDEA (not backlog). Pain discovered 2026-02-25 via logistics industry contact. Truck delivers to 20 customers, driver signs Sammelaufstellung. Physical folder only. Pain: Reklamation requires manual folder search — major time sink. Solution: scan + OCR + embeddings, searchable by customer/date/driver/load. Different from freight parser — this is archival + retrieval. Add to backlog after v1 validated.

children.title: Follow up with Kiril — warm logistics lead
children.description: Kiril (+49 152 21913739) — logistics industry, Andreas's brother's best friend. Confirmed pain: paper digitization is a real problem in logistics. He works at a large company (IT security hurdle = not a direct prospect) but likely knows smaller logistics companies/customers who fit our ICP (50-200 employees, no big IT dept). Action: call or WhatsApp Kiril. Ask: which of his customers or contacts are smaller logistics operations who deal with paper chaos on invoices, BOLs, delivery sheets? Get 2-3 names + intros. A warm intro from an industry insider = highest conversion path we have.

children.title: Found Pyfio UG (haftungsbeschränkt)
children.description: Incorporate MacroHard as UG (haftungsbeschränkt). Required before signing client contracts or invoicing. Andreas is the sole Gesellschafter and Geschäftsführer. Atlas preps all documents and coordinates — Andreas signs.

children.title: Choose company name + Stammkapital (decide)
children.description: ✅ Decided: Pyfio. Stammkapital TBD (recommend €500). Address: Haferweg 30b, 29614 Soltau. Amtsgericht Tostedt.

children.title: Book notary appointment (online or in-person)
children.description: Find a notary for UG founding. 1-person UG with Musterprotokoll = cheapest route (~€105-165 notary fees). Online notary possible since 2023 (e.g. notar.de, notartermin.de) — saves travel. Prepare: full name, address, Stammkapital amount, company name, business purpose (Unternehmensgegenstand). Andreas must attend (physically or video).

children.title: Prepare Musterprotokoll / Gesellschaftsvertrag
children.description: Musterprotokoll draft at /home/jared/.openclaw/agents/atlas/ug-gruendung/musterprotokoll-draft.md. Ready for notary — 2 fields open: Firmenname (Pyfio vs Aempire) + Stammkapital (recommend €500). ELSTER Fragebogen also prepared at fragebogen-steuerliche-erfassung.md.

children.title: Open business bank account
children.description: Open business bank account online. Qonto (https://qonto.com/de) or Holvi (https://holvi.com/de) — both fully online, ~10 min. Deposit €500 Stammkapital immediately after opening. Get bank confirmation letter (Einzahlungsbeleg) — needed before Handelsregister registration.

children.title: Handelsregister registration (via notary)
children.description: After notary signing, notary submits to Handelsregister automatically. Atlas monitors and confirms registration. Timeline: 1-3 weeks typically. Costs: ~€150 Handelsregister fee (notary bills this). Company is 'UG i.G.' (in Gründung) until registered — liability protection not fully active yet.

children.title: Gewerbeanmeldung at Gewerbeamt
children.description: Register trade at local Gewerbeamt (can often be done online). Requires: Handelsregisternummer, personal ID, company address. Fee: ~€20-50. Atlas prepares form, Andreas submits or Atlas submits if online portal allows it.

children.title: Steuerliche Erfassung → Finanzamt → Steuernummer
children.description: Submit Fragebogen zur steuerlichen Erfassung to local Finanzamt (online via ELSTER or paper). Triggers: Steuernummer, USt-IdNr (VAT ID for EU), Körperschaftsteuer registration. Atlas prepares form, Andreas reviews and submits. Timeline: 2-6 weeks for Steuernummer. Request Kleinunternehmerregelung waiver if expecting >€22k revenue.

ideas.title: OpenClaw SaaS offering
ideas.description: Cloud-hosted version of OpenClaw for teams that don't want to self-host.
ideas.rationale: Reduces friction for new users; recurring revenue model.
ideas.key_decisions: Pricing: per-seat 9/mo; multi-tenant with data isolation

ideas.title: Atlas memory persistence via vector DB
ideas.description: Replace flat MEMORY.md with a vector store for semantic recall across sessions.
ideas.rationale: Better long-term context; enables fuzzy search over past decisions.
ideas.key_decisions: Which vector DB (Qdrant, Chroma, pgvector?); cost vs self-hosted

ideas.title: Telos mobile app
ideas.description: Native mobile app for Telos goal tracking.
